verb.description: Alter or move (something) slightly in order to achieve the desired fit, appearance, or result.
examples: he smoothed his hair and adjusted his tie
the interest rate should be adjusted for inflation

verb.description: Assess (loss or damages) when settling an insurance claim.

origin: Early 17th century (in the senses harmonize discrepancies and assess loss or damages): from obsolete French adjuster, from Old French ajoster to approximate, based on Latin ad- to + juxta near.
